medical_history.chief_complaint: Infected breast prostheses after mastectomy reconstruction.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began after the insertion of implants following mastectomy for malignancy. For some patients, initial localized infection signs, including cellulitis and tenderness, developed that did not improve with oral antibiotics and progressed to systemic infection in a few cases.
medical_history.past_medical_history: All patients had previously undergone mastectomy for malignancy. One woman had a distant history of tobacco use. Two women required adjuvant chemotherapy; one required both chemotherapy and radiotherapy. None had a history of diabetes mellitus.
medical_history.social_history: One patient had a distant history of tobacco use, and another admitted to smoking occasionally.
